[[Joan Gamper Trophy]]) | pattern_la1= _thinblackborder|pattern_b1=_fcbarcelona1112h|pattern_ra1=_thinblackborder | pattern_sh1=_fcbarcelona1112h|pattern_so1=_fcbarcelona1112h | leftarm1=0000BF|body1=0000BF|rightarm1=0000BF|shorts1=0000BF|socks1=0000BF | pattern_la2= _thinblackborder|pattern_b2=_fcbarcelona1112a|pattern_ra2=_thinblackborder | pattern_sh2=_fcbarcelona1112a|pattern_so2=_fcbarcelona1112a | leftarm2=000000|body2=000000|rightarm2=000000|shorts2=000000|socks2=000000 | pattern_la3= _thinblackborder|pattern_b3=_fcbarcelona1011a|pattern_ra3=_thinblackborder | pattern_sh3=_fcbarcelona1011a|pattern_so3=_fcbarcelona1011a | leftarm3=78E7CB|body3=78E7CB|rightarm3=78E7CB|shorts3=78E7CB|socks3=78E7CB | prevseason = [[2010â11 FC Barcelona season|2010â11]] | nextseason = ''[[List of FC Barcelona seasons|2012â13]]'' }} The '''2011â12 season''' is '''[[FC Barcelona|Futbol Club Barcelona's]]''' 112th in existence and the club's [[La Liga#All-time La Liga table|81st consecutive season]] in the top flight of Spanish football. Barcelona will be debuting their new and first paid shirt sponsor [[Qatar Foundation]] after an agreement was reached in 2010 with the [[non-profit organization]] for a 5Â½ years, â¬170 million deal.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/castellano/noticies/club/temporada10-11/12/13/n101213114565.html|title=BarÃ§a reach shirt sponsorship agreement with Qatar Foundation|language=Spanish|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2010-12-13|accessdate=2011-05-26}} The agreement with [[UNICEF]] will continue and their name has been moved to the lower back portion of the shirt. {{cite web|url=http://shop.fcbarcelona.com/stores/barcelona/products/product_maxzoom.aspx?maximage=prd_maxzoom_barca-86264.jpg&intPID=86264|title=Barcelona 2011-12 shirts|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-05-17|accessdate=2011-05-26}} This year also introduces a new away kit in black while the third jersey is from last year. This season Barcelona has a chance of winning [[the Sextuple]] which consists of six trophies in a season as they'll be appearing in [[2011â12 La Liga|La Liga]], [[2011â12 Copa del Rey|Copa del Rey]], [[2011-12 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]], [[2011 UEFA Super Cup|UEFA Super Cup]], [[2011 Supercopa de EspaÃ±a|Supercopa de EspaÃ±a]] and the [[2011 FIFA Club World Cup|FIFA Club World Cup]]. Barcelona's U-19 squad will play in the inaugural tournament of the [[2011â12 NextGen series|NextGen series]]. ==Season overview== ===May/June=== On 31 May, [[Sevilla CF|Sevilla]] confirmed they exercised their right to purchase [[defender (association football)|defender]] [[MartÃ­n CÃ¡ceres]], who spent the [[2010â11 Sevilla FC season|2010â11 season]] on loan with the club from Barcelona. Barcelona received â¬4.5 million in compensation after making the loan a permanent move.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada10-11/05/31/n110531117809.html|title=CÃ¡ceres makes permanent move to Sevilla|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-05-31|accessdate=2011-06-21}} ===July=== On 2 July, Barcelona parted ways with [[midfielder]] [[VÃ­ctor SÃ¡nchez Mata|VÃ­ctor SÃ¡nchez]] after both parties agreed to rescind the player's contract. SÃ¡nchez made 14 appearances with the first team in the [[2007â08 FC Barcelona season|2007â2008]] and [[2008â09 FC Barcelona season|2008â2009]] seasons. He was on-loan at [[Xerez CD|Xerez]] for the [[2009â10 FC Barcelona season|2009â10 season]] and at [[Getafe CF|Getafe]] for the [[2010â11 FC Barcelona season|2010â11 season]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/07/02/n110702118241.html|title=SÃ¡nchez leaves BarÃ§a|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-07-02|accessdate=2011-07-02}} On 4 July, defender [[Andreu FontÃ s]] was promoted to the first team after spending the [[2010â11 FC Barcelona season|previous season]] filling in for an injured [[Ãric Abidal]], who had been diagnosed with a liver tumour.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/07/04/n110704118272.html|title=FontÃ s promoted to 1st Team|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-07-04|accessdate=2011-07-07}} On 21 July, Barcelona completed the transfer of [[Chile national football team|Chilean]] [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] [[Alexis SÃ¡nchez]] from [[Italy|Italian]] club [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]]. The deal is for 5 years and the cost of the transfer is â¬26 million with variable cost of â¬11.5 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/07/21/n110614117999.html|title=BarÃ§a sign Alexis SÃ¡nchez|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-07-21|accessdate=2011-07-21}} On 22 July, Barcelona transferred [[La Masia]] graduate [[Bojan KrkiÄ]] to Italian outfit [[AS Roma|Roma]] for â¬12 million and the agreement includes an obligatory re-purchase clause to be exercised by Barcelona at the end of the 2012â13 season, for a cost of â¬13 million. Roma may override this re-purchase at this time by paying the club an additional â¬28 million.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/07/22/n110712118387.html|title=Bojan transferred to AS Roma|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-07-22|accessdate=2011-07-22}} ===August=== On 3 August, [[Portugal|Portuguese]] club [[Sporting Clube de Portugal|Sporting Lisbon]] made official the signing of another Barcelona's La Masia graduate, winger [[JeffrÃ©n SuÃ¡rez]] on a 5 year deal. The transfer deal was worth â¬3.7 million and includes a â¬30 million buyout clause.{{cite web|url=http://www.sporting.pt/Noticias/Futebol/Fut_Prof/notfutprof_futjeffrenaquisicao_030811_78816.asp |title=JeffrÃ©n makes Sporting switch|publisher=Sporting.pt|language=Portuguese|date=2011-08-03|accessdate=2011-08-03}} On 4 August, Barcelona and [[Argentina|Argentine]] [[centre-back]] [[Gabriel Milito]] reached an agreement to terminate his contract after four years with the team.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/08/04/n110804118663.html|title=Milito allowed to depart|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-08-04|accessdate=2011-08-04}} On 14 August, both Barcelona and [[England|English]] club [[Arsenal FC|Arsenal]] announced on their official websites respectively, an agreement for the transfer of [[Spain national football team|Spanish international]] midfielder [[Cesc FÃ bregas]]. The deal will cost Barcelona â¬29 million with â¬11 million in variables and end one of the longest transfer sagas in football.{{cite web|url=http://www.arsenal.com/news/news-archive/arsenal-agree-terms-with-barca-for-fabregas|title=Arsenal announces FÃ bregas transfer.|publisher=Arsenal.com|date=2011-08-14|accessdate=2011-08-14}}{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/destacades/n110815118780.html|title=BarÃ§a finally get FÃ bregas.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-08-14|accessdate=2011-08-14}}{{cite web|url=http://www.as.com/futbol/articulo/cesc-barcelona/20110814dasdasftb_41/Tes|title=FÃ bregas' transfer detailed.|publisher=AS.com|language=Spanish|date=2011-08-14|accessdate=2011-08-14}}{{cite web|url=http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20110812/fc-barcelona/arsenal-cesc-barca-la-negociacion-mas-larga-del-mundo_54198935099.html|title=Transfer 4 years in the making.|publisher=MundoDeportivo.com|language=Spanish|date=2011-08-14|accessdate=2011-08-14}}{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/942813/arsenal-skipper-fabregas-finally-signs-for-barcelona?cc=5901|title=Transfer numbers.|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-08-15|accessdate=2011-08-15}} On the same day, Barcelona and [[Real Madrid]] kicked off the 2011â12 season with a 2â2 draw at the [[Santiago BernabÃ©u Stadium|Santiago BernabÃ©u]] in the [[2011 Supercopa de EspaÃ±a|first leg]] of the 2011 Supercopa de EspaÃ±a in front of a full house.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report?id=330062&cc=5901|title=Draw to kick off the new season.|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-08-14|accessdate=2011-08-14}} On 17 August, Barcelona won the Supercopa de EspaÃ±a with a thrilling 3â2 win and a 5â4 aggregate over rivals Real Madrid. The match ended with several [[Misconduct (association football)#Sending-off offences (red card)|sending offs]] for a brawl started after Barcelona players deemed a tackle by [[Marcelo Vieira|Marcelo]] on FÃ bregas to be dangerous play. [[David Villa]], [[Mesut Ãzil]] and Marcelo all received their marching orders after calm was restored.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/330063?cc=5901|title=Barcelona 3-2 Real Madrid|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-08-17|accessdate=2011-08-17}} Goals from [[AndrÃ©s Iniesta]] and a brace, including the game winner, by [[Lionel Messi]] assured BarÃ§a started their season with a trophy by claiming their tenth Supercopa all time. On 19 August, the [[Association of Spanish Footballers]] (AFE) went on strike due to unpaid wages for players in the top two divisions of Spanish football by clubs who have gone into financial administration. The AFE and [[Liga de FÃºtbol Profesional]] (LFP) have yet to agreed on a guaranteed fund to protect players' wages in the event of their clubs being declared insolvent.{{cite web|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/945843/la-liga-fixtures-postponed-by-strike?cc=5901|title=La Liga strikes|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-08-19|accessdate=2011-08-20}} The strike forced Spanish league games scheduled for the weekend of August 20 and 21, including Barcelona's season opener against [[MÃ¡laga CF|MÃ¡laga]], to be postponed. On 25 August, Lionel Messi was voted the winner of the inaugural [[UEFA Best Player in Europe Award]] for the 2010â11 season over team-mate [[Xavi HernÃ¡ndez]] and Real Madrid's [[Cristiano Ronaldo]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefa/uefa-best-player-award/news/newsid=1667736.html#messi+wins+uefa+best+player+europe+award|title=Messi wins inaugural UEFA Best Player in Europe Award.|publisher=[[UEFA]].com|date=2011-08-25|accessdate=2011-08-25}} On 26 August, Barcelona won the UEFA Super Cup with a 2â0 victory over Portuguese outfit [[F.C. Porto|Porto]] in [[Monaco]]. The victory gave BarÃ§a their [[List of UEFA Super Cup winners#Performances|fourth]] UEFA Super Cup trophy all time and saw FÃ bregas score his first goal with a Barcelona shirt in the 88th minute.{{cite web|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_11-12/arxiu_partits/supercopa_europa/final/jornada01/Barcelona_oporto/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a wins UEFA Super Cup|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-08-26|accessdate=2011-08-26}} ===September=== On 10 September, back from the [[FIFA]] international break, Barcelona could only draw 2â2 with [[Real Sociedad]] at [[Anoeta]].{{citeweb|url=http://fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_11-12/arxiu_partits/lliga/jornada03/Real_Sociedad_Barcelona/partit.html|title=Draw after the international break.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-09-10|accessdate=2011-09-10}} BarÃ§a also lost Alexis SÃ¡nchez for approximately 6â8 weeks after the player tore his [[hamstring]] in his right leg after a tackle by Sociedad's [[Daniel Estrada Agirrezabalaga|Dani Estrada]].{{citeweb|url=http://fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/09/10/n110910119161.html|title=Alexis injured.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-09-10|accessdate=2011-09-10}} On 13 September, Barcelona opened their UEFA Champions League campaign with a 2â2{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_11-12/arxiu_partits/champions_league/primera_fase/jornada01/grup_H/Barcelona_Milan/partit.html|title=Draw in 1st CL match.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-09-13|accessdate=2011-09-13}} draw against [[AC Milan|Milan]] at the [[Camp Nou]]. Midfielder AndrÃ©s Iniesta left in the 38th minute with a tore [[Biceps femoris muscle|femoral biceps]] on his left leg and will miss approximately a month.{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/09/13/n110913119212.html|title=Iniesta to miss a month.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-09-13|accessdate=2011-09-13}} On 17 September, after two consecutive draws Barcelona trashed [[CA Osasuna|Osasuna]] 8â0 at Camp Nou. Lionel Messi scored a [[Hat-trick#Football (Association football)|hat-trick]] and lead BarÃ§a to their biggest win of the season.{{citeweb|url=http://www.mundodeportivo.com/20110917/fc-barcelona/8-0-un-gran-barca-despeja-dudas-con-una-goleada-a-osasuna_54217247690.html|title=BarÃ§a humiliate Osasuna.|publisher=MundoDeportivo.com|language=Spanish|date=2011-09-17|accessdate=2011-0918}} Osasuna coach [[JosÃ© Luis Mendilibar]] stated, "we've caught them very angry due to their so called mini-crisis"{{citeweb|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/09/17/futbol/equipos/osasuna/1316293662.html|title=Mendilibar speaks about the trashing.|publisher=[[MARCA]].com|language=Spanish|date=2011-09-17|accessdate=2011-0918}}, while BarÃ§a's coach Pep Guardiola stated in regards to the ''mini-crisis'', "the day I see them not running, that their bellies are full, I'll sit here to tell you all [media]. When we play bad, believe me I'll come here and tell you all. But I did not have that sensation".{{citeweb|url=http://www.marca.com/2011/09/17/futbol/equipos/barcelona/1316294998.html|title=Guardiola on the mini-crisis.|publisher=[[MARCA]].com|language=Spanish|date2011-09-17|accessdate=2011-09-18}} On 28 September, Barcelona defeated [[BATE Borisov]] 0â5{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_11-12/arxiu_partits/champions_league/primera_fase/jornada02/grup_H/bate_Barcelona/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a notch their 1st Group H win.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-09-28|accessdate=2011-09-28}} at the [[Dynama Stadium (Minsk)|Dynama Stadium]] in their first meeting in Group H of the Champions League. Lionel Messi scored a brace and tied [[LÃ¡szlÃ³ Kubala]] for 2nd place on the [[List of FC Barcelona records and statistics#Players|all-time goals scoring list]] for Barcelona with 194 goals.{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/09/28/n110928119478.html|title=Messi draws even with Kubala.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-09-28|accessdate=2011-09-28}} ===October=== On 2 October, Barcelona defeated [[Sporting de GijÃ³n|Sporting GijÃ³n]] 0â1{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_11-12/arxiu_partits/lliga/jornada07/Sporting_Gijon_Barcelona/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a go top.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-10-02|accessdate=2011-10-02}} at [[El MolinÃ³n]] to take over 1st place in La Liga's [[2011â12 La Liga#League table|standings]] for the first time this season. A lone goal by [[Adriano Correia|Adriano]] was enough to see the team go top by goal difference over [[Levante UD|Levante]]. On 19 October, Barcelona notched its second Champions League victory of the season by defeating [[Czech Republic|Czech]] side [[FC Viktoria PlzeÅ|Viktoria PlzeÅ]] 2â0 at the Camp Nou.{{citeweb|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2012/matches/round=2000263/match=2007616/postmatch/report/index.html|title=BarÃ§a beat PlzeÅ.|publisher=[[UEFA]].com|date=2011-10-19|accessdate=2011-10-27}} On 22 October, BarÃ§a were held scoreless for the first time in the young season by a ''heroic'' performance from [[Sevilla FC|Sevilla's]] GK [[Javi Varas]]. The match ended with a scoreless draw after Lionel Messi's penalty kick was saved by Varas in injury time. The match towards the end was marred by a small brawl between [[FrÃ©dÃ©ric KanoutÃ©]] and Cesc FÃ bregas as the latter took offense to KanoutÃ© kicking the ball from the penalty spot after Messi had placed it to take the spot kick.{{citeweb|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/report/_/id/323957?cc=5901|title=BarÃ§a 0-0 Sevilla.|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-10-22|accessdate=2011-10-27}} After he match, FÃ bregas was accused of racially abusing KanoutÃ©, which the player vehemently denied and at the end both players apologized over the incident by telephone.{{citeweb|url=http://soccernet.espn.go.com/news/story/_/id/974017/barcelona%27s-cesc-fabregas-denies-racially-abusing-frederic-kanoute?cc=5901|title=FÃ bregas accused of racism.|publisher=ESPNSoccernet.com|date=2011-10-23|accessdate=2011-10-27}} On 25 October, Barcelona traveled to [[Estadio Nuevo Los CÃ¡rmenes|Los CÃ¡rmenes]] to take on [[Granada CF|Granada]] where they escaped with a 0â1 victory after a 33rd minute goal from a free-kick by [[Xavi]].{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/futbol/temporada_11-12/arxiu_partits/lliga/jornada10/Granada_Barcelona/partit.html|title=BarÃ§a claim narrow win.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-10-25|accessdate=2011-10-27}} BarÃ§a also lost FW [[Pedro RodrÃ­guez Ledesma|Pedro]] for approximately three weeks due to an strained tendons in his left ankle.{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/10/26/n111026119959.html|title=Pedro suffers ankle injury in Granada.|publisher=2011-10-26|accessdate=2011-10-27}} ===November=== On 1 November, the 23-men shortlist for the [[FIFA Ballon d'Or|2011 FIFA Ballon dâOr]] was released with 8 Barcelona players. They include Ãric Abidal, [[Dani Alves]], Cesc FÃ bregas, AndrÃ©s Iniesta, Lionel Messi, [[Gerard PiquÃ©]], [[David Villa]] and Xavi.{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/11/01/n111101120063.html|title=[[FIFA Ballon dâOr]] 2011.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-11-01|accessdate=2011-11-02}} Later that night, Barcelona defeated Viktoria PlzeÅ 0â4 in [[Praha|Prague]] at the [[Synot Tip Arena]] with a hat-trick by Messi and assured their progress into the [[2011â12 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|knock-out stage]]. With the three goals, he surpassed the 200 goal mark as a Barcelona player in Pep Guardiola's 200th game as first team manager.{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/11/01/n111101120061.html|title=Guardiola reaches 200 games.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-11-01|accessdate=2011-11-02}} Goalkeeper [[VÃ­ctor ValdÃ©s]] broke the team record for most minutes without conceding a goal at 877 consecutive minutes. He surpasses [[Miguel Reina]] record of 824 minutes set in the [[1972â73 La Liga|1972â73 season]].{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.cat/web/english/noticies/futbol/temporada11-12/11/01/n111101120076.html|title=ValdÃ©s breaks team shutout record.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-11-01|accessdate=2011-11-02}} On 9 November, the first leg of the Round of 16 of the Copa del Rey was moved up due to Barcelona's involvement in the [[2011 FIFA Club World Cup]] in December. BarÃ§a won the match 0â1 with a strike outside the area by AndrÃ©s Iniesta in the 42nd minute.{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/detail/article/l-hospitalet-fc-barcelona-once-again-exemplary-0-1|title=BarÃ§a debut in the Cup.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-11-09|accessdate=2011-11-10}} On 22 November, assistant coach [[Francesc Vilanova|Tito Vilanova]] was successfully operated for problem in his [[parotid gland]]. The club did not release anymore information on the matter due to the coaches wishes to have everything remain private.{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/detail/article/tito-vilanova-recovering-after-successful-surgery|title=Tito Villanova successfully operated.|publisher=FCBarcelona.cat|date=2011-11-22|accessdate=2011-11-23}} The next day, Barcelona defeated Milan at the [[San Siro]] 2â3 in a thrilling European encounter to win [[2011â12 UEFA Champions League group stage#Group H|Group H]].{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/match-archive/2011-2012/champions-league/round-5-h/milan_fc-barcelona|title=BarÃ§a win Group H.|publisher=FCBarcelona.com|date=2011-11-23|accessdate=2011-11-28}} On 26 November, BarÃ§a lost its first official match of the season with a 1â0 defeat at [[Getafe FC|Getafe]] with a goal by [[Juan Valera EspÃ­n|Juan Valera]] in the 67th minute.{{citeweb|url=http://www.fcbarcelona.com/football/first-team/detail/article/getafe-fcb-first-defeat-of-the-season-1-0|title=BarÃ§a see 1st defeat.|publisher=FCBarcelona.com|date=2011-11-27|accessdate=2011-11-28}} The defeat leaves Barcelona 6 points back of Real Madrid with 2 matches before [[el ClÃ¡sico]]. ==Players== ===Squad information=== {{fb si header |age=y}} {{fb si player |bg= |n=1 |pos=GK |nb=ESP |p=[[VÃ­ctor ValdÃ©s|V.
